alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Grady; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 22 at 1:58PM EDT until July 22 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Decatur County in southwestern Georgia... Southwestern Grady County in southwestern Georgia... Southeastern Seminole County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 245 PM EDT. * At 158 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles northeast of Chattahoochee, or 12 miles southwest of Bainbridge, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cairo, Bainbridge, Whigham, West Bainbridge, Attapulgus, Climax, Hanover, Reynoldsville, Recovery, Faceville, Harrells Still, Reno, Fowlstown, Princes Still, Peoples Still and Nickleville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
